verses.verse: Maschil <WH4905> of Asaph <WH623>. O God <WH430>, why hast thou cast us off <WH2186> for ever <WH5331>? why doth thine anger <WH639> smoke <WH6225> against the sheep <WH6629> of thy pasture <WH4830>?

Remember <WH2142> thy congregation <WH5712>, which thou hast purchased <WH7069> of old <WH6924>; the rod <WH7626> of thine inheritance <WH5159>, which thou hast redeemed <WH1350>; this mount <WH2022> Zion <WH6726>, wherein thou hast dwelt <WH7931>.
Lift up <WH7311> thy feet <WH6471> unto the perpetual <WH5331> desolations <WH4876>; even all that the enemy <WH341> hath done wickedly <WH7489> in the sanctuary <WH6944>.
Thine enemies <WH6887> roar <WH7580> in the midst <WH7130> of thy congregations <WH4150>; they set up <WH7760> their ensigns <WH226> for signs <WH226>.
A man was famous <WH3045> according as he had lifted up <WH935> <WH4605> axes <WH7134> upon the thick <WH5442> trees <WH6086>.
But now they break down <WH1986> the carved work <WH6603> thereof at once <WH3162> with axes <WH3781> and hammers <WH3597>.
They have cast <WH7971> fire <WH784> into thy sanctuary <WH4720>, they have defiled <WH2490> by casting down the dwelling place <WH4908> of thy name <WH8034> to the ground <WH776>.
They said <WH559> in their hearts <WH3820>, Let us destroy <WH3238> them together <WH3162>: they have burned up <WH8313> all the synagogues <WH4150> of God <WH410> in the land <WH776>.
We see <WH7200> not our signs <WH226>: there is no more any prophet <WH5030>: neither is there among us any that knoweth <WH3045> how long <WH5704>.
O God <WH430>, how long shall the adversary <WH6862> reproach <WH2778>? shall the enemy <WH341> blaspheme <WH5006> thy name <WH8034> for ever <WH5331>?
Why withdrawest <WH7725> thou thy hand <WH3027>, even thy right hand <WH3225>? pluck <WH3615> it out of <WH7130> thy bosom <WH2436> <WH2436>.
For God <WH430> is my King <WH4428> of old <WH6924>, working <WH6466> salvation <WH3444> in the midst <WH7130> of the earth <WH776>.
Thou didst divide <WH6565> the sea <WH3220> by thy strength <WH5797>: thou brakest <WH7665> the heads <WH7218> of the dragons <WH8577> in the waters <WH4325>.
Thou brakest <WH7533> the heads <WH7218> of leviathan <WH3882> in pieces, and gavest <WH5414> him to be meat <WH3978> to the people <WH5971> inhabiting the wilderness <WH6728>.
Thou didst cleave <WH1234> the fountain <WH4599> and the flood <WH5158>: thou driedst up <WH3001> mighty <WH386> rivers <WH5104>.
The day <WH3117> is thine, the night <WH3915> also is thine: thou hast prepared <WH3559> the light <WH3974> and the sun <WH8121>.
Thou hast set <WH5324> all the borders <WH1367> of the earth <WH776>: thou hast made <WH3335> summer <WH7019> and winter <WH2779>.
Remember <WH2142> this, that the enemy <WH341> hath reproached <WH2778>, O LORD <WH3068>, and that the foolish <WH5036> people <WH5971> have blasphemed <WH5006> thy name <WH8034>.
O deliver <WH5414> not the soul <WH5315> of thy turtledove <WH8449> unto the multitude <WH2416> of the wicked: forget <WH7911> not the congregation <WH2416> of thy poor <WH6041> for ever <WH5331>.
Have respect <WH5027> unto the covenant <WH1285>: for the dark <WH4285> places of the earth <WH776> are full <WH4390> of the habitations <WH4999> of cruelty <WH2555>.
O let not the oppressed <WH1790> return <WH7725> ashamed <WH3637>: let the poor <WH6041> and needy <WH34> praise <WH1984> thy name <WH8034>.
Arise <WH6965>, O God <WH430>, plead <WH7378> thine own cause <WH7379>: remember <WH2142> how the foolish man <WH5036> reproacheth <WH2781> thee daily <WH3117>.
Forget <WH7911> not the voice <WH6963> of thine enemies <WH6887>: the tumult <WH7588> of those that rise up <WH6965> against thee increaseth <WH5927> continually <WH8548>.
